title: Two fishermen missing, four rescued after another boat capsizes in seas off Tangalle
byline: Another boat accident has been reported in seas off Tangalle.

title: At least 81 people killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza
byline: At least 81 Palestinians have been killed and more than 400 injured in Israeli strikes across Gaza in the 24 hours until midday on Saturday, the Hamas-run health ministry said.

title: G7 agrees to avoid higher taxes for US and UK companies
byline: The United States and the Group of Seven nations have agreed to support a proposal that would exempt U.S. companies from some components of an existing global agreement, the G7 said in a statement on Saturday.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers are expected in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (29), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Police steps in to rescue youth from drowning in seas off Ussangoda Beach
byline: Sri Lanka Police lifeguards have rescued two youth from drowning after the duo who went for a swim at the Ussangoda Beach was caught in a strong current and dragged into the sea.

title: Delhi to see Its first-ever artificial rain to combat air pollution in July
byline: Delhi is set to witness artificial rain aimed at reducing air pollution, with cloud seeding scheduled between July 4 and 11, Delhi Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa has said.

title: 5.3-magnitude earthquake hits central Pakistan
byline: A magnitude-5.3 earthquake struck central Pakistan on Sunday morning (Jun 29), according to the United States Geological Survey.

title: Special Parliament sitting tomorrow
byline: A special sitting of Parliament is scheduled to take place tomorrow (30).

title: Five killed in four separate road accidents
byline: Five individuals have died in four separate road accidents that occurred in several areas in the past 24 hours, police stated.

title: Dr. Sanjeewa Thennakoon re-elected as GMOA President
byline: Dr. Sanjeewa Thennakoon has been re-appointed as the President of the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA).

title: Eight persons who went missing after visiting Hanthana Mountain Range rescued
byline: A group of eight individuals, including children between the ages of 12 and 24, who went missing while visiting the Hanthana Mountain Range in Kandy has been rescued.

title: Beruwala Boat Accident: Bodies of two fishermen wash ashore
byline: The bodies of the two fishermen onboard a boat which capsized off the coast of Moragalla, Beruwala yesterday (28), have reportedly washed ashore at the Bentota Beach this morning, police stated.

title: Eight Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in seas off Mannar
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized an Indian fishing boat and apprehended eight Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters, north of Mannar.

title: Rampant cybercriminal group targets US airlines
byline: A notorious cybercriminal group has shifted its attention to the aviation industry, successfully breaching the computer networks of multiple airlines in the United States and Canada this month, according to the FBI and private experts responding to the hacks.

title: Beechcraft KA-350 aircraft deployed to locate missing fishermen in Tangalle seas
byline: A Sri Lanka Air Force (SLAF) Beechcraft KA-350 aircraft has been deployed this morning to locate the two missing fishermen who were onboard a multi-day fishing vessel which met with an accident off the coast of Paravi Wella Beach in Tangalle.

title: Colombo Port container clearance delay resolved, says Customs
byline: Sri Lanka Customs states that the congestion and the delays previously experienced in the clearance of import containers at the Colombo Harbour have now been resolved.

title: Sri Lanka will not cede Katchatheevu Island to any faction: Fisheries Minister
byline: The Katchatheevu Island belongs to Sri Lanka and will not be handed over to any other party under any circumstances, Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources Ramalingam Chandrasekar has asserted.

title: Israel orders evacuations in northern Gaza as Trump calls for war to end
byline: The Israeli military ordered Palestinians to evacuate areas in northern Gaza on Sunday before intensified fighting against Hamas, as U.S. President Donald Trump called for an end to the war amid renewed efforts to broker a ceasefire.

title: Iran says 71 killed in Israeli strike on Evin Prison
byline: Israel’s attack on the Evin Prison in Iran’s capital Tehran last week killed 71 people, Iranian judiciary spokesperson Asghar Jahangir said on Sunday (Jun 29).

title: Authorities urged to revive ornamental fish industry
byline: Authorities have been urged to support the ornamental fish breeders by renovating the Ornamental Fish Breeding Centre in Aralaganwila which reportedly helped bring in foreign exchange to the country for several years.

title: Vehicles worth Rs. 30 mln of powerful politician’s associate seized in Bandaragama
byline: Two luxury vehicles valued at over Rs. 30 million, allegedly imported into the country illegally, have been seized by police in Bandaragama.

title: ‘No space for Bezos’: Hundreds protest against billionaire’s wedding on final day of Venice celebrations
byline: Hundreds of people filled the streets and waterways of Venice to protest against the wedding of Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez on the final day of their multimillion-dollar celebrations.

title: Three earthquakes hit Pakistan within 24 hours
byline: A third earthquake within 24 hours jolted Pakistan on Sunday, a statement by the National Center for Seismology (NCS) said.

title: Body of missing fisherman found after boat capsizes in seas off Tangalle
byline: The body of one of the two fishermen who went missing after a multi-day fishing vessel capsized in the seas off the coast of Paravi Wella in Tangalle, has been recovered.

title: Drug trafficker with open warrant arrested in Kalutara North
byline: A suspect involved in drug trafficking, who had a pending open warrant issued by the court, has been arrested in the Kalutara North area.

title: CAA rejects claims of maximum price for salt
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) strongly denies media reports claiming that a maximum retail price for salt was determined during a discussion held between the CAA and the Salt Manufacturers’ Association of Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka achieved 70% renewable energy generation in June 2025 - CEB
byline: Sri Lanka has reached 70% renewable energy generation during June 2025, the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said.

title: UN nuclear watchdog chief says Iran could again begin enriching uranium in ‘matter of months’
byline: The head of the UN’s nuclear watchdog says US strikes on Iran fell short of causing total damage to its nuclear program and that Tehran could restart enriching uranium “in a matter of months,” contradicting President Donald Trump’s claims the US set Tehran’s ambitions back by decades.

title: Committee appointed to investigate recent fishing vessel capsizing incidents
byline: Deputy Minister of Fisheries, Aquatic and Ocean Resources, Rathna Gamage, announced that a special committee has been appointed to investigate the recent incidents of fishing vessels capsizing at sea.
